Question: What precautions should be taken while handling the product?
Answer: When handling the product, wear appropriate clothing to prevent skin contact (long sleeves and trousers as a minimum). Wear chemically protective gloves that are heat resistant and insulated when handling hot product. Ensure adequate ventilation if user's operations generate vapours or mist. Use make-up air to balance exhaust ventilation. Have an eyewash station and safety shower close to the work-station. When working with the product, consider using safety goggles and/or a face shield in case of splashing. NIOSH approved respirators may be necessary if concentrations exceed occupational exposure limits. Dispose of spills according to regional regulations.
